Interruptible.description: If set to false, no priority quest (e.g. class quests) will be done while this is the currently active quest

Steps.description: All steps necessary to complete the quest sequence. If a sequence has no steps (e.g. if it is cutscene-only), this element should not be used.

DataId.description: The data id of the NPC/Object/Aetheryte/Aether Current

StopDistance.description: Set if pathfinding should stop closer or further away from the default stop distance

IgnoreDistanceToObject.description: Most interactions with objects are checked for a Y (height) difference of 2 in-game units. If set to true, the game won't attempt to get any closer if the height difference is larger than this.

RestartNavigationIfCancelled.description: For some specific loading screen transitions (e.g. when entering/leaving the water through the portals in the ruby sea), setting this to 'false' means it won't re-attempt to move to the portal after the loading animation

TerritoryId.description: The territory id associated with the location

TargetTerritoryId.description: If set, this step is complete (movement-wise) if this territory id is reached

InteractionType.description: What to do at the position

Disabled.description: Whether this step is disabled (see SkipIf for more control)

DisableNavmesh.description: If true, will go to the position in a straight line instead of using pathfinding

Mount.description: If true, will mount regardless of distance to position. If false, will unmount.

Fly.description: If true and flying is unlocked in a zone, will use a flight path

Land.description: If true and flying, will attempt to land on the ground

AetheryteShortcut.description: The Aetheryte to teleport to (before moving)

AethernetShortcut.description: A pair of aethernet locations (from + to) to use as a shortcut

RequiredQuestVariables.description: Certain quests (primarily beast tribes/allied societies) have a RNG element to spawning targets, and the step should be skipped in its entirety if none of the sets below match

RequiredCurrentJob.description: Which class or job you are using whenever this step gets executed

RequiredQuestAcceptedJob.description: Which class or job you were using when accepting this quest (e.g. for beast tribes)

AetherCurrentId.description: The aether current id, used to check if a given aetheryte is unlocked

EnemySpawnType.description: Determines how enemy spawning is handled in combat locations

KillEnemyDataIds.description: The enemy data ids which are supposed to be killed

ComplexCombatData.description: If multiple different enemies are supposed to be killed in a single quest step, this typically is handled via items

DataId.description: The enemy data id which is supposed to be killed

NameId.description: Name id of the enemy which is supposed to be killed, helpful if multiple nearby enemies share the same DataId

MinimumKillCount.description: Overworld mobs: If this number of mobs has been killed, will wait a bit before attempting to pull another mob to see if the quest progresses

CombatItemUse.description: Unlike the 'AfterItemUse' condition that is used for spawning an enemy in the first place, interacting with an item at a certain stage of combat is required

StopDistance.description: Set if pathfinding should stop closer or further away from the default stop distance

LowPriority.description: Indicates that this dungeon is included in the 'Skip certain optional dungeons and raids' option

Index.description: If a quest has multiple solo instances (which affects 5 quests total), indicates which one this is

PickUpQuestId.description: Determines the quest which should be accepted. If empty/null, accepts the quest corresponding to the file name.

TurnInQuestId.description: Determines the quest which should be turned in. If empty/null, turns in the quest corresponding to the file name.

NextQuestId.description: For quest chains (e.g. DT healer role quests) Which quest to do next, given that you meet the required level.

ItemsToGather.description: Unlike crafting steps, which will always craft a single item id regardless of class, this allows for gathering different items depending on whether you've picked the quest up as miner or botanist

AlternativeItemId.description: For leves that allow you to gather two items with different chance percentage, this is the preferred item if the gathering chance is 100% (after buffs)
